remarks.para: May be inoperative provided an accepted procedure is used to ensure brakes are cool before engine start.

note.para: Avoid possibility of retracting an overheated wheel by leaving landing gear extended for ten minutes after takeoff. Pilots must consider possibility of ice accumulation with landing gear extended during winter operations.
In case of engine failure after V1, landing gear should be retracted until takeoff obstacles are cleared.

numlitem.para: If not obstacle limited after takeoff, avoid the possibility of retracting a wheel overheated by dragging brakes by leaving gear extended for 10 minutes.
In case of engine failure after V1, climb performance is the prime consideration. Landing gear should be retracted until at or above OCA then extended for a 10 minute cooling period.
During winter operations from contaminated runways retract the landing gear until reaching OCA, then extend the landing gear for a 10 minute cooling period.
Dispatch may be delayed to meet proviso.
Add 850 lbs. MEL fuel usage (10 minute gear down operation for brake cooling).

placard.para: Placard adjacent to WHL WELL FIRE Light "INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Brakes must be checked for being cool (when hand can be held on brake housings) immediately prior to starting engine.
Inform dispatch that flight planning may be affected.
If wheel well detection sensor(s) are failed closed, the EICAS warning message WHEEL WELL FIRE and WHEEL WELL FIRE light may be deactivated.
To deactivate the EICAS warning message WHEEL WELL FIRE and WHEEL WELL FIRE light, open and collar the W/W FIRE DET circuit breaker on P11 panel.
Place additional placard next to the WHEEL WELL FIRE light "WHEEL WELL FIRE LIGHT DEACTIVATED".

note.para: The center panel FIRE light and First Officer's panel WHEEL WELL FIRE light will extinguish. The Fire light will continue to be operative for engine fire and overheat detection.
